Limited access to recycling facilities: Not everyone may have access to recycling facilities in their area, which could make it difficult for them to participate in the initiative.
Resistance from certain industries: Some industries may resist participating in the recycling initiative, as it could negatively impact their profits.
Inadequate funding: The city may not have enough funding to support the recycling initiative, which could limit its effectiveness.
Lack of education: Without proper education on how to recycle, people may not know how to properly dispose of their waste, which could result in contamination of the recyclables.
Inadequate infrastructure: The city may not have the necessary infrastructure in place to support the recycling initiative, such as recycling bins and transportation.
